page.title: 01Ecology
page.content: The area provides a variety of interesting habitats,natural and man made.The River Rother floods regularly providing feeding grounds for birds although the river itself is heavily polluted.There are many ancient hedgerows which provide a rich habitat and food supply for many small animals and birds.The areas of rough grazing provide a more environment for birds,such as skylarks and lapwings and small mammals,such as rabbits and foxes and shrews.Foxstone wood,Whinnybank wood and the man made lake,which was originally constructed to provide water for coal washing at Renishaw pit,provide an attractive home for woodland species as it is an area of mixed planting.
